attributes.overallObjectives: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to human psychology, examining the biological, cognitive, and social factors that influence behavior. Students will explore major psychological theories while developing critical thinking skills through research analysis and experimental design. Emphasis is placed on understanding both individual and group behavioral patterns.
classObjectives: Week 1 | Foundations of Psychology: Explore major theories and research methods
Week 2 | Brain and Behavior: Study neural basis of psychological processes
Week 3 | Learning and Memory: Analyze how experiences shape behavior
Week 4 | Emotion and Motivation: Examine factors driving human actions
Week 5 | Social Psychology: Investigate group dynamics and influence
Week 6 | Personality Theory: Study individual differences and development
Week 7 | Psychological Disorders: Understand mental health and treatment
Week 8 | Final Project: Design and conduct behavioral research study
